Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2008 11:57PM tampachick wrote: Hi, All I wore at the hospital was their gown and socks and my undies. I wore a velour sweat suit going there and coming home. Bring something to zip up, nothing over the head. For home, more comfy pants and larger zip up tops, hoodies. I was able to move my arms fine after to eat, drink. I clip my drains to the bra, no problems. Great sports bra is the Natori brand. I am 5 days out from the 1 step and doing well. Vicodin helped better then the morphine drip for me. Good luck and big Hugs! Steph
Posts.Title: Is there a "packing list" for surgery? Panchoandlefty lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2008 01:01AM tampachick wrote: Hang in there, I know they like them in as long as they can stay in so it drains all the fluid. Mine were in for 9 days. It's almost over and it will feel SOO good! Hugs
Posts.Title: Drains??? immalovinyou BessB

Posts.Content: tampachick wrote: Hi Ladies, I was dx in Jan: IDC, stage 1, grade 3, triple neg, 1.4cm. I had chemo and rad that ended in June. I tested positive for BRCA1 in July and now I am thinking about a bilat after all that. Where do I start? I need to get a breast surgeon and PS, correct? I am in Tampa and looking for recommendations. I'd go to Boston, NY or south florida too. I'd love to keep the nipples but I highly doubt that will happen. Do you guys have pics of yours you would share? How long did it take you to find a doc and then schedule surgery? Thanks! Steph email:stephquake@yahoo.com 33 yrs old (dx 1/24/07, IDC, stg 1, triple neg. Lumpectomy, chemo and rads - done 6/07. One step bilat mast Jan 08 Dx 1/24/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, 0/7 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 1/26/2007 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Surgery 1/30/2008 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Surgery 7/31/2013 Prophylactic ovary removal Log in to post a reply
